jobs.title: Clinical Assessor and Coverage Provider (Hybrid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Clinical Assessor and Coverage Provider - (Hybrid, Full-Time)
Virginia, United States

About the role

AnswersNow is looking for a Clinical Assessor and Coverage Provider (“CACP”) who will be the first clinical point of contact for Virginia Medicaid families seeking virtual ABA services with AnswersNow. The CACP will be responsible for completing an in-person direct observation in the client’s home, including a parent interview. The CACP will then complete the rest of the ABA initial assessment. This role includes regional travel possibly including overnight stays.

Job Details

  • Full-Time W2

  • Regional Openings:

    • (Southwest) Virginia, Roanoke

    • (Southeast)- Virginia Beach, Chesapeake

    • (North)- Washington DC

Job Requirements

  • Master’s degree with a focus in Behavior Analysis or similar

  • Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification (required)

  • At least 5 years-experience (post-certification) in applied settings providing both case management and staff supervision

  • Experience providing ABA therapy and caregiver training as well as conducting assessments via telehealth (preferred)

  • Valid drivers license

  • Reliable personal vehicle for transportation

What we offer

  • Flexible compensation: potential to earn up to $110,000k+

  • Long-Term Incentive: Equity Incentive through equity ownership in AnswersNow

  • Reimbursement for Travel: Cover major travel expenses, including daily meal stipend

  • Flexible Time-Off: Paid time off and company holidays

  • Continuing Education: CEUs provided through internal and invited speakers, and monthly newsletters sharing low or no-cost virtual events

  • Health Benefits: Medical, vision and dental care options

  • Other Benefits: Employee Assistance Program (EAP), 401K, Monthly Development Fund and professional verbal and written communication skills

What you’ll do

  • Conduct initial assessments and make clinical recommendations for treatment dosage within a virtual, focused care model of ABA therapy

    • Conduct in-person observations in the client’s natural environment to include general observation, FBAs, direct assessments, and caregiver interviews

    • Write high-quality initial treatment plans and review these plans with the clients’ families and ongoing Clinical Care Provider to ensure alignment

    • Effectively transition clients to ongoing Clinical Care Provider

  • Complete all clinical documentation according to AnswersNow policies and professional standards (i.e., timeliness, completeness, etc.)

  • Communicate directly with families to schedule in-person initial assessments and required virtual follow up

  • Attend company and team meetings as scheduled (i.e., Monthly All Hands, Monthly Care Delivery Team Meeting, Weekly 1:1 with direct supervisor)

  • Conduct virtual initial assessments as assigned by Clinical Leadership

  • Maintain continuity of care by providing coverage last-minute and advanced vacation coverage for other clinicians

  • Provide short-term care to clients while they wait for long-term placement with their ongoing BCBA as assigned by Clinical Leadership

  • Provide at minimum of 25 billable hours per week on average

More About AnswersNow

At AnswersNow, we’re committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a pleasant and supportive place to work. We'd love to have you come join us here! AnswersNow is fully remote and open to hiring folks within the US. For more information, please visit getanswersnow.com.

jobs.title: Remote BCBA- Direct Therapy (United States)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
BCBA - Direct Therapy Provider (Part-Time & Full-Time)
Remote, United States

About Us

At AnswersNow, we are reimagining what ABA therapy can be—accessible, effective, and centered around outcomes. As a certified BCBA, you'll deliver direct virtual care to families through our proprietary platform built by clinicians, for clinicians.

We’re growing fast and are looking for BCBAs who are committed to quality care and equitable access. Whether full-time or part-time, you’ll play a key role in reshaping autism therapy—while working 100% from home! If you're ready to make a meaningful impact and join a team that's reshaping autism therapy, we’d love to hear from you!

Job Details

  • W-2 Employee

  • Full-time and Part-time Options

  • Direct Therapy

  • Non-Supervisory (RBT-Free Model)

Job Requirements

  • Must be a Board Certified Behavior Analyst

  • Must have availability Monday-Friday from 3pm - 8pm ET / 12pm - 6pm PT

    • Full time employees: requires 30-40 total hours per week

    • Part time employees: requires up to 20 total hours per week

  • Digital fluency: video calls, Google suite, data systems, etc.

  • Reliable internet connection

  • Must reside in the United States (Does not include Puerto Rico or US Virgin Islands)

What you'll do

  • Provide virtual Caregiver Training, Caregiver Mediated, and Direct 1:1

  • Conduct remote assessments and behavior plans

  • Ensure quality care through ongoing documentation

  • Coordinate care and collaborate with our clinical team

What we offer

  • Annual Salary up to $100K or more!

    • Compensation Philosophy: At AnswersNow, your impact drives your income! Our variable compensation model rewards clinicians for time spent supporting families — the more families you help, the more you earn! With unlimited earning potential, you control your salary based on delivered billable hours.

  • Company laptop for virtual sessions (Choice of Mac or PC)

  • AI note-taking technology

  • Extended paid time off + company holidays

  • FREE In-house CEUs

  • Medical, vision and dental care options

Our Commitments to You

  • Primary focus on clinical quality and outcomes

  • Ongoing training and support

  • Collaborative team environment

  • Regular check-ins with clinical leadership

  • Transparency across the organization

More About AnswersNow

At AnswersNow, we’re committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. AnswersNow is fully remote and open to hiring folks within the US. For more information, please visit getanswersnow.com.

jobs.title: Director of Revenue Cycle Management
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Director of Revenue Cycle Management
Remote, Anywhere in the US

About AnswersNow

At AnswersNow, we are trailblazing the future of autism therapy, making it more immediate, accessible, and effective for families everywhere. Our innovative virtual ABA therapy platform is thoughtfully designed by clinicians to recreate the focused, supportive environment of in-person therapy, complete with distraction-free features and interactive activities that enhance engagement and progress.

Our team operates fully remotely—meaning you’ll have the flexibility to work from home, and will never have to report on-site to provide client support. If you're ready to make a meaningful impact and join a team that's reshaping autism therapy, we’d love to hear from you!

About the Role

The Director of RCM will lead the day-to-day operations and continuous improvement of our revenue cycle — ensuring clean claims, fast collections, and accurate revenue recognition. You’ll manage internal and outsourced teams responsible for collections, while partnering closely with Finance, Product, and Clinical Operations to drive strong financial performance and operational excellence.

Job Details

  • W2 Employee

  • Full-Time (Remote)

Job Requirements

  • 6–8 years of progressive experience in healthcare revenue cycle management.

  • Demonstrated success improving key RCM metrics (collection rate, AR days, first-pass yield).

  • Hands-on experience with EHR, clearinghouse, and billing integrations.

  • Proven ability to manage vendors and lead internal or outsourced RCM teams.

  • Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel, Google Sheets, and Mode or similar BI tools.

What You’ll Do

  • Oversee end-to-end revenue operations including claims submission, payment posting, denials, and collections.

  • Own and optimize workflows in Candid, our external RCM platform, ensuring data accuracy, process efficiency, and high collection performance.

  • Manage the patient billing process and ensure a clear, transparent, and family-friendly billing experience.

  • Analyze data to uncover operational issues (e.g., coding errors, payer lag) and drive corrective action with Candid and internal partners in Clinical Operations.

  • Report RCM performance and insights to Finance and executive leadership.

  • Lead and mentor a small team focused on billing, collections, and denial management.

Nice to Haves

  • Prior exposure to ABA therapy, behavioral health, or Medicaid billing.

  • Experience using Candid and other modern RCM tools.

  • Familiarity with AI-driven RCM automation or workflow tools.

What we Offer

  • $135,000- $200,000 annual salary

    • Compensation Philosophy: The base pay for this position ranges from $135,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $200,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

  • Fully remote – work from anywhere in the U.S.

  • Flexible hours with an async-friendly team culture

  • Opportunity to work with modern tools and shape foundational systems

More About AnswersNow

At AnswersNow, we believe that innovation should be inclusive. We welcome team members from all backgrounds, experiences, and identities. Our fully-remote team operates with trust, autonomy, and respect. Learn more about us at getanswersnow.com.
